meanings.definition: To write or draw (something) again in a different way.
meanings.sent1: She had to redraft her essay after receiving feedback from her teacher.
meanings.sent2: Authors often redraft their manuscripts multiple times before publishing.
meanings.sent3: The student's attempt to redraft his messy handwriting only made it worse.
meanings.sent4: Like a sculptor shaping clay, she redrafted her story until it flowed smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The painter would redraft his sketches until they captured the perfect light.

meanings.definition: A revised version of a piece of writing or drawing.
meanings.sent1: The final redraft of the novel was much improved from the first draft.
meanings.sent2: The artist proudly displayed the redraft of her painting at the gallery.
meanings.sent3: The redraft of the play had the audience laughing at new jokes added.
meanings.sent4: The redraft of the map included updated roads and landmarks.
meanings.sent5: The redraft of the contract clarified the terms for both parties involved.
